instruction: [INST] Analyze this file to learn MacBook motherboard repair. The 'definitions' section explains key technical terms. The 'threads' section contains real-world repair discussions. Use both sections to understand and learn how to troubleshoot MacBook issues. Posts from username 'larossmann' , 'dukefawks' , and '2informaticos' are posts from trusted experts.[/INST]

definitions.820-2936: What is 820-2936? a LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER.
definitions.PPBUS_G3H: What is PPBUS_G3H? Main system power rail that charges the battery, or is power from the battery, that everything else is powered from. .
definitions.PP5V_S5: What is PP5V_S5? This is a 5v power rail that is present when the machine is in an S5 soft off state..
definitions.U7000: What is U7000? U7000 refers to the ISL6258 or ISL6259 charging IC on Macbooks from 2008-2012.

threads.title: [SOLVED]Running out of FETs
threads.message:
<LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>820-2936</LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER> Water damage. Have made lots of progress. <SIGNAL>PPBUS_G3H</SIGNAL> is 3.23V.
I don't have my 3.3V rail, but do have <SIGNAL>PP5V_S5</SIGNAL>. I notice if I diode mode to ground on L7220-1 I get 0.130. I have changed <TRANSISTOR>Q7220</TRANSISTOR> and also changed <CHIP>U7200</CHIP> a couple times. Once I change I do my diode mode reading and something like 0.300 something that looks more normal. But once I connect power it goes back down to 0.025 or something really low. So I am guessing something else to blame.
My general question is: should I change all of these at once? <CHIP>U7200</CHIP>, <TRANSISTOR>Q7220</TRANSISTOR>, <TRANSISTOR>Q7260</TRANSISTOR>, <TRANSISTOR>Q7261</TRANSISTOR>, & <TRANSISTOR>Q7221</TRANSISTOR>?

threads.title: [SOLVED]Running out of FETs
threads.message: I know I need to go back and check my ISL and current sensing resistors. I did change ISL and resistors were way bad. I need to recheck the second set. I think it was around 3.0Ohms, so I assume they were good.

threads.title: [SOLVED]Running out of FETs
threads.message: Why are you messing with <CHIP>U7200</CHIP> when PPBUS is not even present? Is PP3V42 even there? If yes then probably still problem in <CHIP>U7000</CHIP> area.

threads.title: [SOLVED]Running out of FETs
threads.message:
Fixed.  I had a lot of work and lots of other questions. But I have figured them all out.  Thank you Duke.
I apologize for being brain dead sometimes. Overworked, fatigued & stress I start to get stupid real fast.  Been on this one for 5 days and finally got it : )
But thank you for pointing me in the right direction. Yes, it makes a lot of sense now. So my dumb question actually bared more fruit than I thought! Thank you again!
